services.name: GPT-4o
services.description: Here are some example generated prompts using GPT-4o.
prompts: family-thailand.jpg:'A cinematic, 16:9 illustration of a happy family of four enjoying their vacation in Thailand. The mother is in the foreground taking a selfie, with a bright, joyful smile. Behind her, the father, a young son, and a young daughter are all smiling warmly, standing close together within arms length of the camera. The background shows a classic Thai beach scene: soft white sand, crystal-clear turquoise waters, tall palm trees swaying in the breeze, and a limestone cliff or island in the distance. The lighting is warm and sunny, and the color palette vibrant, capturing the essence of a perfect tropical vacation. The image should feel like a moment captured in a high-quality DSLR photo, blending realism with a painterly charm.'

prompts.title: 80s-Inspired 'Be Happy' Sticker with Thumbs-Up
prompts.prompt: Create a vibrant and colorful sticker design that embodies the aesthetic of the 1980s. The sticker should feature bold and bright colors, typical of the era. At the center of the design, include a large, cartoonish thumbs-up symbol, exuding positivity and enthusiasm. Overlay the image with the text: "Don't worry, be happy" in a font style that echoes the cheerful and carefree vibe of the 1980s. The text should be playful and lively, possibly with a neon or glowing effect to emphasize its upbeat message. The overall composition should evoke a sense of joy and nostalgia for the 1980s, making it look like an authentic piece of memorabilia from the decade.

prompts.title: A thai woman
prompts.prompt: A photorealistic portrait of a smiling 25-year-old thai girl with long, flowing black hair and striking brown eyes with sunglass wearing white t-shirt. She should have a natural, approachable expression and be illuminated by soft, golden-hour sunlight. The background should be a scenic outdoor setting, perhaps a sunlit beach. Capture this image with a high-resolution photograph using an 85mm lens for a flattering perspective.

prompts.title: Surreal Cityscape at Night
prompts.prompt: Create an image depicting a surreal cityscape at night, where the buildings twist and turn like ribbons against a starry sky. The architecture should blend futuristic elements with Art Nouveau styles, creating a scene that is both alien and familiar. The city is alive with glowing neon lights in a spectrum of colors, reflecting off twisting streets that seem to defy gravity. In the foreground, a river meanders through the city, its surface a mirror to the dazzling lights above. This scene should challenge the boundaries between reality and imagination, showcasing the AI's ability to merge architectural precision with the fluidity of dreamscapes.

prompts.title: The Awakening of an Ancient Forest
prompts.prompt: Imagine an ancient forest at the moment of awakening, where every tree and plant is imbued with ethereal light. This image should capture the instant when the forest's ancient magic is rekindled, with spirits of nature visibly emerging from the flora. The trees are colossal, their roots deep and intertwined, while their leaves shimmer with a luminescent glow. A pathway leads into the heart of the forest, illuminated by floating orbs of light, inviting the viewer on a journey into the unknown. This scene should test the AI's ability to blend fantasy elements with a photorealistic natural environment, creating a sense of wonder and enchantment.
prompts.filename: The Awakening of an Ancient Forest.webp

prompts.title: The Melancholy of a Rainy Parisian Street
prompts.prompt: Generate an image that captures the melancholy and beauty of a rainy street in Paris in the early 20th century. The scene is set during the blue hour, with the cobblestone streets glistening under the soft glow of gas street lamps. Pedestrians with umbrellas stroll past quaint cafes and bookshops, their reflections blurred in the wet pavement. In the distance, the silhouette of the Eiffel Tower looms, partially obscured by the mist. This image should convey a sense of nostalgia and romance, challenging the AI to accurately depict historical details, weather effects, and the nuanced emotions of a bygone era.
prompts.filename: The Melancholy of a Rainy Parisian Street.webp

prompts.title: Family Vacation Bliss in Thailand
prompts.prompt: Generate a photo-realistic, 16:9 cinematic photograph of a family enjoying their vacation in Thailand. The image should capture a heartwarming moment where the mother, positioned in the foreground, is taking a selfie with her family, including the father, a boy, and a girl. They should all be smiling, appearing happy and relaxed, within arm's length of the camera to create a sense of intimacy and joy. In the magnificent background, the quintessential Thai beach should unfold, showcasing powdery white sands, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and lush palm trees swaying gently in the breeze. The composition should be reminiscent of a high-quality, inspiring DSLR photo, filled with vibrant colors and the natural beauty of Thailand, encapsulating the essence of a perfect family vacation.

prompts.title: A sketch of a woman standing on a cliff looking at the sea in a fancy art style
prompts.prompt: A sketch of a woman standing on a cliff looking at the sea in a fancy art style
prompts.filename: A sketch of a woman standing on a cliff looking at the sea in a fancy art style..jpg

prompts.title: Hopeful Gaze in Coffee Tones
prompts.prompt: Create a duotone image with a 'coffee' color tone. The subject is a young woman, her gaze uplifted in a hopeful expression. Her features are bathed in a soft light that casts gentle shadows across her face. She wears a flowing dress, with a hand delicately holding a dandelion ready to blow in the wind. The style is a charcoal sketch, rich in textures, blending realism with a touch of whimsy. The background should be simple, focusing attention on the woman and the dandelion

styles.info: A generic placeholder for early 20th-century newspaper comic strips, inspired by the vibrant and varied styles of the era. No specific artist or work is referenced, allowing for creative interpretation within the public domain. EU: ✅ / USA: ✅
styles.stylePrompt: In the style of an early 20th-century newspaper comic strip, featuring bold black ink outlines, minimal shading, and vibrant or monochromatic color schemes depending on the publication. Characters are expressive with exaggerated features like large eyes or exaggerated gestures, set against simple, hand-drawn backgrounds that emphasize humor or adventure. Use a grainy paper texture to evoke the feel of vintage newsprint.

styles.info: The earliest strips from 1929 by E.C. Segar (d. 1938) are in the public domain in both regions. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popeye
styles.stylePrompt: In the gritty, high-contrast black-and-white style of a 1929 newspaper comic strip, drawn with rough, thick ink lines and cross-hatching for texture. Characters have bulbous noses, squinting eyes, and exaggerated, muscular builds, with a rugged, working-class aesthetic. Backgrounds depict coastal or urban scenes with cluttered details like barrels, ropes, or tenements, rendered on a slightly yellowed, textured newsprint surface. Emphasize dynamic action poses and slapstick humor.

styles.info: Only the first story, 'Tintin in the Land of the Soviets' (1929), is in the US public domain. All of Hergé's (d. 1983) works are copyrighted in the EU. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Adventures_of_Tintin
styles.stylePrompt: In the Belgian 'ligne claire' style of 1929, characterized by clean, uniform-weight black lines and flat, vibrant colors with no hatching or gradients. Characters are cartoony with simplified, expressive faces, while backgrounds are highly detailed and realistic, depicting exotic locales like deserts or cities with architectural precision. Compositions are balanced, with a focus on clarity and narrative flow, set against a crisp, white paper texture.

styles.info: The original comic strip from 1929 is in the US public domain. Not in the EU, as Calkins died in 1962. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buck_Rogers
styles.stylePrompt: In the retro-futuristic style of a 1929 science fiction comic strip, featuring sleek Art Deco-inspired spaceships, ray guns with glowing beams, and angular alien worlds with crystalline structures. Use bold black outlines, limited shading, and a palette of muted silvers, blues, and oranges to evoke pulp adventure. Characters wear streamlined uniforms or helmets, set against starry skies or bizarre planetary landscapes, with a grainy newsprint texture.

styles.info: Created in 1905 and solidly in the public domain in both regions (McCay d. 1934). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Nemo
styles.stylePrompt: In a surreal, dreamlike Art Nouveau comic panel style, featuring flowing, organic lines and intricate, fantastical architecture like spiraling towers or oversized furniture. Use a vibrant palette of pastel pinks, blues, and yellows, with delicate gradients and fine detailing. Characters are whimsical, with exaggerated proportions, set in shifting, nonsensical dreamscapes that defy gravity and logic, rendered on a smooth, high-quality paper texture.

styles.info: The early strips from 1897 are in the US public domain, but not the EU, as Dirks died in 1968. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Katzenjammer_Kids
styles.stylePrompt: In the chaotic, early 20th-century cartoon style, featuring bold, simple black outlines and minimal color (reds, blues, yellows) on a textured newsprint background. Characters are mischievous, with exaggerated expressions and dynamic poses, engaged in slapstick pranks. Backgrounds are cluttered with everyday objects like furniture or tools, and speech balloons contain accented, humorous dialogue in a playful, hand-lettered font.

styles.info: Started in 1913. It is in the public domain in both regions (Herriman d. 1944). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Krazy_Kat
styles.stylePrompt: In a surrealist black-and-white ink wash style, featuring minimalist, ever-shifting desert landscapes with abstract cacti, mesas, and crescent moons. Use loose, expressive brushstrokes and heavy ink splashes for texture, with characters drawn in a loose, whimsical style. Dialogue is poetic and nonsensical, written in a quirky, hand-drawn font, set against a slightly yellowed, textured paper background.

styles.info: Debuted in 1913. In the public domain in both regions, as McManus died in 1954 (PD in EU from Jan 1, 2025). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bringing_Up_Father
styles.stylePrompt: In a refined 1910s Art Deco comic strip style, featuring elegant, clean lines and a muted palette of greens, golds, and creams. Characters wear stylish, high-society clothing like tuxedos or flapper dresses, set in opulent interiors with geometric patterns or luxurious cityscapes. Compositions are balanced, with a focus on domestic comedy, rendered on a crisp, white paper texture with subtle newsprint grain.

styles.info: The early strips from 1918 are in the US public domain, but not the EU, as King died in 1969. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gasoline_Alley
styles.stylePrompt: In the warm, nostalgic style of an early 20th-century American suburbia comic strip, featuring detailed, hand-drawn ink illustrations with soft cross-hatching. Use a cozy palette of browns, greens, and soft yellows to depict small-town scenes, family homes, or garages. Characters are relatable, with expressive faces and casual clothing, engaging in gentle, heartwarming humor, set on a textured, slightly aged newsprint surface.

styles.info: The earliest versions from 1919 are in the US public domain, but not the EU due to Messmer (d. 1983). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felix_the_Cat
styles.stylePrompt: In the bold, black-and-white style of a silent film-era cartoon, featuring high-contrast ink drawings and surreal, fluid transformations (e.g., objects morphing into characters). Characters have wide, gleaming eyes, toothy grins, and exaggerated movements, set against minimalist urban or fantastical backgrounds. Use a grainy, flickering texture reminiscent of old film reels to evoke a playful, mischievous tone.

styles.info: Started in 1917. In the public domain in both regions (Smith d. 1935). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Gumps
styles.stylePrompt: In a 1920s comic strip style, featuring clean, straightforward black ink lines and a limited palette of reds, blues, and yellows. Depict middle-class family life with cozy interiors, period clothing, and gentle domestic humor. Backgrounds are detailed but uncluttered, with furniture or neighborhood scenes, rendered on a slightly yellowed newsprint texture to evoke everyday warmth and relatability.

styles.info: Started in 1907. In the public domain in both regions, as Fisher died in 1954 (PD in EU from Jan 1, 2025). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mutt_and_Jeff
styles.stylePrompt: In the energetic, early 20th-century newspaper comic style, featuring bold, dynamic black ink lines and minimal color (black, white, with occasional reds or blues). Characters are a tall, lanky figure and a short, stout companion, engaged in slapstick antics with exaggerated expressions. Backgrounds are simple, focusing on urban or sports settings, rendered on a textured newsprint surface with a playful, chaotic energy.

styles.info: Started in 1912. The early strips are in the US public domain, but not the EU (Sterrett d. 1964). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polly_and_Her_Pals
styles.stylePrompt: In a vibrant, Art Deco-inspired comic strip style with Cubist influences, featuring bold, angular lines and a bright palette of reds, yellows, and greens. Backgrounds are surreal, with abstract geometric shapes or stylized cityscapes, while characters wear fashionable 1920s flapper dresses or suits. Compositions are dynamic, with a whimsical, experimental feel, set on a clean, white paper texture.

styles.info: The original strips from 1919 are in the public domain (DeBeck d. 1942). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_Google_and_Snuffy_Smith
styles.stylePrompt: In a 1920s cartoony comic strip style, featuring characters with large, expressive 'googly' eyes and exaggerated proportions. Use bold black outlines and a limited palette of primary colors (reds, blues, yellows) to depict absurd, humorous scenes of sports, gambling, or rural life. Backgrounds are lively, with dynamic lines and cluttered details, rendered on a textured, slightly aged newsprint surface.

styles.info: Started in 1908. The early strips are in the US public domain, but not the EU (Fox d. 1964). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toonerville_Folks
styles.stylePrompt: In the style of a single-panel, early 20th-century cartoon, featuring eccentric small-town characters with quirky expressions and period clothing. Use clean, bold ink lines and a limited color palette of earth tones and pastels to depict humorous, observational scenes of trolleys, shops, or community life. Render on a textured newsprint background with a folksy, nostalgic tone.

styles.info: The first story, 'The Curse of Capistrano' (1919), is in the US public domain, but not the EU (McCulley d. 1958). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zorro
styles.stylePrompt: In a dramatic, pulp adventure style set in Spanish California, featuring shadowy, high-contrast black-and-white visuals with bold ink lines. Depict a masked hero in a cape and hat, wielding a sword, against moonlit haciendas or rugged landscapes. Use deep blacks, stark whites, and minimal shading to evoke mystery and action, rendered on a textured, pulpy paper surface.

styles.info: Started in 1927 and is in the US public domain, but not the EU (McClure d. 1987). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Annie_Rooney
styles.stylePrompt: In the heartwarming, 1920s adventure comic strip style, featuring soft, detailed ink lines and a warm palette of blues, pinks, and yellows. Depict a resilient young protagonist in tattered clothing, set against urban or rural scenes with detailed buildings or landscapes. Emphasize emotional storytelling and dynamic compositions, rendered on a slightly yellowed newsprint texture.

styles.info: One of the first comic strips (1895). Solidly in the public domain (Outcault d. 1928). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Yellow_Kid
styles.stylePrompt: In the chaotic, late 19th-century newspaper comic style, featuring crowded urban street scenes with multiple characters in tattered clothing. Use bold, uneven ink lines and a limited palette of yellows, reds, and blues, with dialogue written directly on characters’ clothing or in balloons. Backgrounds are cluttered with tenements or markets, rendered on a coarse, yellowed newsprint texture.

styles.info: A pioneer from 1900. Is in the public domain (Opper d. 1937). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Happy_Hooligan
styles.stylePrompt: In a Vaudeville-era comic strip style, featuring clean, bold ink lines and a limited color palette of reds, blues, and yellows. Depict a gentle tramp character with a patched coat and tin-can hat, engaged in slapstick misadventures. Backgrounds are simple, with urban or rural settings, rendered on a textured newsprint surface with a lighthearted, comedic tone.

styles.info: The early strips from 1922 are in the US public domain. EU status is complex due to later artists. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fritzi_Ritz
styles.stylePrompt: In a stylish, 1920s 'flapper' comic strip style, featuring clean, elegant Art Deco-inspired lines and a vibrant palette of reds, greens, and golds. Depict a fashionable young woman in chic dresses, set against geometric cityscapes or jazz-age interiors. Compositions are sleek and humorous, rendered on a crisp, white paper texture with a nod to 1920s glamour.

styles.info: This wordless novel from 1929 is in the US public domain, but not the EU (Ward d. 1985). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gods%27_Man
styles.stylePrompt: In a dramatic, Expressionist woodcut style, featuring stark black-and-white contrasts and angular, textured lines. Depict emotional, symbolic scenes of human struggle or triumph, with exaggerated, sculpted figures and surreal, shadowy backgrounds. Use deep blacks and sharp whites to evoke a moody, narrative-driven aesthetic, rendered on a rough, woodblock-like texture.

styles.info: A genre of Japanese woodblock prints and paintings produced between the 17th and 20th centuries, featuring subjects from history, landscapes, and urban life. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukiyo-e
styles.stylePrompt: In the Japanese Ukiyo-e woodblock print style, featuring bold, flowing black outlines and flat areas of vibrant color (blues, reds, greens). Depict stylized landscapes, like waves or mountains, or figures in traditional kimonos, with asymmetrical compositions and delicate details. Use a textured, handmade paper background to evoke the tactile quality of woodblock prints.

styles.info: A small, richly detailed painting from a manuscript or book. Known for its intricate details, strong colors, and scenes from mythology and poetry. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persian_miniature
styles.stylePrompt: In the Persian miniature style, featuring intricate, jewel-toned colors (turquoise, crimson, gold) and delicate, ornate details. Depict epic or poetic scenes with elegant figures in flowing robes, set against lush gardens or tiled palaces. Use a flat perspective, gold leaf accents, and intricate floral borders, rendered on a smooth, parchment-like texture.

styles.info: The highly symbolic and stylized art found on the walls of tombs and temples in Ancient Egypt, known for its composite view (profile head, frontal torso). URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Art_of_ancient_Egypt
styles.stylePrompt: In the Ancient Egyptian mural style, featuring figures in profile with frontal eyes and torsos, drawn with precise black outlines and flat colors (reds, yellows, blues, blacks). Depict gods, pharaohs, or daily life scenes with hieroglyphic symbols, set against a papyrus or weathered stone texture. Use a grid-like composition for balance and symbolic storytelling.

styles.info: The art style found in pre-Columbian folding books from the Maya civilization, characterized by hieroglyphic script and ritualistic scenes. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maya_codices
styles.stylePrompt: In the Mayan codex style, featuring elegant black and red outlines on a fibrous, bark-paper texture. Depict gods, nobles, or rituals with elaborate headdresses and symbolic glyphs, using a flat color palette of reds, blacks, and ochres. Compositions are structured with horizontal bands or grids, emphasizing symmetry and ceremonial grandeur.

styles.info: A style of traditional Chinese landscape painting that involves depicting scenery or natural landscapes, often with a philosophical, monochrome aesthetic. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shan_shui
styles.stylePrompt: In the Chinese Shan shui ink wash style, featuring vast, monochromatic landscapes of mist-shrouded mountains, rivers, and waterfalls. Use expressive, calligraphic brushstrokes in shades of black and gray, with subtle gradients on rice paper texture. Include minimalistic details like tiny figures or boats to evoke a sense of scale, harmony, and philosophical depth.

styles.info: A style of South Asian painting, heavily influenced by Persian miniatures, known for its realistic detail, formal portraiture, and depictions of courtly life. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mughal_painting
styles.stylePrompt: In the Mughal miniature style, featuring highly detailed, realistic portraits or court scenes with vibrant colors (emerald, ruby, gold). Depict emperors, courtiers, or nature scenes with intricate clothing and jewelry, set against ornate backgrounds with floral or geometric borders. Use a flat perspective and a smooth, parchment-like texture to evoke regal elegance.

styles.info: A style of monochrome ink wash painting where subjects are painted with a brush dipped in black ink, emphasizing simplicity, beauty, and spiritualism. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ink_wash_painting
styles.stylePrompt: In the minimalist Sumi-e ink wash style, featuring fluid, expressive black ink brushstrokes on textured rice paper. Depict simple yet evocative subjects like bamboo, birds, or mountains, using varying ink concentrations for depth and texture. Emphasize negative space, balance, and a serene, spiritual aesthetic with subtle gray gradients.

styles.info: The art style of traditional shadow puppets from Java and Bali. The puppets are intricately carved from leather to create detailed silhouettes. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayang_kulit
styles.stylePrompt: In the Wayang Kulit shadow puppet style, featuring intricate, stylized silhouettes with perforated details, rendered in black against a glowing, backlit white screen. Depict mythical figures or warriors with elaborate costumes and dynamic poses, using delicate, lace-like patterns to suggest movement and storytelling, evoking a theatrical, mystical atmosphere.

styles.info: A traditional style of painting based on ancient symbols and stories of the Australian Aboriginal peoples, using intricate patterns of dots to form larger images. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aboriginal_Australian_art
styles.stylePrompt: In the Aboriginal dot art style, featuring intricate patterns of dots in earthy tones (reds, ochres, whites, blacks) to create symbolic imagery like animals, landscapes, or Dreamtime stories. Use a textured, canvas-like background to depict aerial or spiritual perspectives, with rhythmic, interconnected dot patterns evoking cultural narratives.

styles.info: The pictographic and ideographic art style found in manuscripts from the Aztec Empire,meet the criteria for public domain status in both regions. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aztec_codices
styles.stylePrompt: In the Aztec codex style, featuring thick, bold black outlines and flat, vibrant colors (reds, blues, yellows) on a textured animal hide or bark paper background. Depict gods, warriors, or rituals with stylized, geometric forms and pictographic symbols, arranged in grid-like or sequential compositions to tell historical or mythological stories.

styles.info: A unique Christian art tradition, known for its stylized figures with large, almond-shaped eyes, bold colors, and dark outlines, often painted on wood or in manuscripts. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_art
styles.stylePrompt: In the Ethiopian religious icon style, featuring stylized figures with large, almond-shaped eyes, golden halos, and bold, flat colors (reds, blues, yellows) outlined in heavy black. Depict saints or biblical scenes with symmetrical compositions, set against a textured wood or parchment background, evoking spiritual reverence and cultural tradition.

styles.info: A style of decorative ceramic art from the Ottoman Empire, famous for its intricate floral (tulips, carnations) and geometric patterns on a white base. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iznik_pottery
styles.stylePrompt: In the Ottoman Iznik pottery style, featuring intricate floral patterns (tulips, carnations) and geometric designs in vibrant cobalt blue, turquoise, and red against a brilliant white background. Use flowing, symmetrical compositions with delicate, hand-painted details, rendered on a smooth, glazed ceramic texture to evoke elegance and craftsmanship.

styles.info: The traditional art of the Haida people of the Pacific Northwest, characterized by continuous, flowing lines (formlines) that create stylized animal and mythic figures. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formline_art
styles.stylePrompt: In the Haida formline art style, featuring bold, flowing black and red lines with ovoid and U-form shapes to create stylized depictions of animals like eagles, ravens, or bears. Use a limited palette of black, red, and white, with intricate, interlocking patterns set against a smooth, wood-like texture, evoking spiritual and cultural significance.

styles.info: A folk painting style from the Mithila region of India, characterized by its complex geometric patterns, double-line borders, and use of natural dyes. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madhubani_art
styles.stylePrompt: In the Madhubani folk art style, featuring intricate, hand-drawn geometric patterns and double-line borders filled with vibrant natural dyes (reds, blues, yellows). Depict mythological figures, gods, or nature scenes with stylized, expressive forms, covering the entire canvas in a dense, decorative composition, rendered on a textured paper or cloth background.

styles.info: A genre of Korean folk art known for its vibrant colors, naive or 'primitive' style, and use of symbolic motifs like tigers, magpies, and flowers. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minhwa
styles.stylePrompt: In the Korean Minhwa folk art style, featuring vibrant, bold colors (reds, greens, blues) and a naive, playful aesthetic. Depict symbolic animals like a humorous tiger or magpie, alongside flowers or landscapes, with simple, flat forms and minimal shading. Use a textured paper background to evoke optimism and cultural storytelling.

styles.info: Cast-metal plaques and sculptures that decorated the royal palace of the Oba of Benin, known for their stylized realism and detailed depictions of court life. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benin_Bronzes
styles.stylePrompt: In the Benin Bronze relief style, featuring stylized, realistic figures of kings, warriors, or courtiers in ceremonial dress, cast in a textured bronze patina. Use intricate, low-relief details with bold outlines and subtle shading to depict dynamic scenes of court life, set against a metallic, weathered background with cultural symbolism.

styles.info: A modern East African painting style, characterized by its use of vibrant enamel paints on board and its cartoonish, flat depictions of African wildlife. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tingatinga_(painting)
styles.stylePrompt: In the Tingatinga painting style, featuring vibrant, glossy enamel paints (bright reds, blues, yellows) to create flat, cartoonish depictions of African animals like lions or zebras. Use bold black outlines and decorative, colorful backgrounds with simple patterns, rendered on a smooth board texture to evoke a playful, modern African aesthetic.

styles.info: A Tibetan Buddhist painting on cotton or silk, typically depicting a Buddhist deity, scene, or mandala, known for its extreme detail and symbolism. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thangka
styles.stylePrompt: In the Tibetan Thangka painting style, featuring a highly detailed, symmetrical composition of a central Buddhist deity with intricate patterns and smaller figures. Use vibrant colors (reds, blues, golds) with delicate gold accents and fine brushwork, set against a textured cotton or silk background, evoking spiritual depth and meditative focus.

styles.info: A Mexican folk art style of painting on amate, a fibrous bark paper. The paintings often depict brightly colored birds, animals, and village scenes. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amate
styles.stylePrompt: In the Mexican Amate folk art style, featuring vibrant, stylized birds, animals, or village scenes with intricate patterns in bright colors (reds, greens, yellows). Use bold black outlines on a dark, fibrous bark paper texture to create a lively, handcrafted aesthetic, with dense compositions that evoke rural Mexican life.

styles.info: Visual symbols from the Akan people of Ghana that represent concepts or aphorisms. They are used extensively in fabrics, pottery, and logos. URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adinkra_symbols
styles.stylePrompt: In the Adinkra printed fabric style, featuring repeating geometric symbols (e.g., spirals, knots) stamped in bold black ink on a woven, earth-toned cloth background (ochres, browns). Arrange symbols in rhythmic, grid-like patterns to convey cultural meanings, evoking a textured, handcrafted aesthetic with a focus on balance and symbolism.

tips.title: Prompt Engineering
tips.content: Always be specific in your prompts ...
